definition:
A function $W\colon {\mathbb{C}}^n \to {\mathbb{C}}$ of the form
$$W(z_1,\ldots,z_n) = z_n^m + \sum_{j=1}^{m-1}a_j(z_1,\ldots,z_{n-1})z_n^j ,$$
where the $a_j$ are holomorphic functions in a neighbourhood of the
origin, which vanish at the origin, is called a [*Weierstrass
polynomial*]{}.

Any codimension 1 complex analytic subvariety of ${\mathbb{C}}^n$ can be
written as the zero set of a Weierstrass polynomial using the
Weierstrass preparation theorem. This in general cannot be done for
higher codimension.

[9]{} Lars Hörmander. [**]{}, North-Holland Publishing Company, New
York, New York, 1973. Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing,
Providence, Rhode Island, 1992.
